intro: Platyzoma rupestre, commonly known as the rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
